publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and adding names and scene cuts.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I got to tell you, Rick. It’s pretty great to be in this spaceship, just the two of us, you know? Just cruising around, Rick and Morty style.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I agree, Morty. [ Belches ] It’s nice to get back to the basics after a pretty intense, mixed-bag of a year.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ohh!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Relax. That’s what windshields are for.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I didn’t know that there were bugs out in space.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Well, w-what did you think, Morty? Life just developed on earth by itself? Here, let me take care of this.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Geez, Rick, that’s disgusting. I don’t want to look at that.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, guess I’m out of fluid. L-let me find a place to stop. Hey, muchacho, does your planet have wiper fluid yet, or are you gonna freak out and start worshipping us?

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: The general store ought to have what you need.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Thanks.

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: Of course, you’ll be wanting to be gone from here by sundown.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, sure thing. Wait a minute. What? Why?

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: Sundown is when the festival begins.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: The festival?

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: Ooh, well, for millennia, our society has been free of crime and war, living in perfect peace.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, I know what this is! You’ve been able to sustain world peace because you have one night a year where you all run around robbing and murdering each other without consequence.

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: That’s right.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: What?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: It’s like "the purge," Morty. That movie "the purge"?

sp.speaker: Farmer
sp.p: Oh, have you been here before?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: No, no, but I’ve been to a few planets with the same gimmick. You know, sometimes it’s called the cleansing or the red time. There was this one world that called it just murder night. I-it’s a purge planet. They’re peaceful, and then, you know, they just purge.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: T-that’s horrible!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah. You want to check it out?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: So, what do you do during the festival? You lock yourself in, or you go out and do some stuff?

sp.speaker: General Store Owner
sp.p: Oh, I do some pretty bad stuff.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, I bet you do, old timer. [ Laughs ]

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Gee... Rick, come on. The sun is setting. W-we got to get out of here.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: All right, well, w-what do I owe you for the wiper fluid?

sp.speaker: General Store Owner
sp.p: It’s on the house. Oh, and, uh, why... why don’t you have some candy bars, as well?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, no way. That’s really nice of you.

sp.speaker: General Store Owner
sp.p: I’m a nice guy... For now.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: [ Chuckling ] Ohh, I don’t doubt it.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, yeah. Hey, have a good festival, old timer.

sp.speaker: General Store Owner
sp.p: I intend to.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick, unlock it!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Just a second, Morty. Oh, look at that sunset.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Stop screwing around.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: There we go. Much better. Now we can see.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Great.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey, you know what, Morty? Why don’t we christen our squeaky-clean windshield here by watching a little of this purge through it?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: What?! No! What is your problem?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty, grow up. If you don’t want to watch, don’t watch, but, you know, it’s my car. [ Belches ] Also, if you tell your mom about this, I’ll purge you.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You’re the worst. And this planet is the worst. How can you be into this? You know, people are gonna kill each other.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: So, what, y-y-you trying to sit here and tell me that [belches] I-if... if there’s a video online with someone getting decapitated, you don’t click on it?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No! Why... why would I do that? You do that?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I don’t, because it would bore me. I see shit like that for breakfast, Morty. But if you don’t do it, I say it’s because you’re afraid of your own primal instincts. So you stuff them down and... [ Bell chiming ] Oh, oh! Shh. Shh. It’s starting. Oh-ho-ho! Here we go.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I’m not watching.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, yeah, yeah, your medal’s in the mail. I’m gonna get a closer look.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, okay, sure. And then someone’s gonna throw a rock and hit the car and then we’re gonna crash and we’re gonna be stuck down there and it’s gonna be what we deserve.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yawn. Whoa! [ Indistinct shouting ] Whoa, they are purging the F[Bleep] out of each other. [ Muffled screaming ] Oh, my God! Oh [Bleep] That was... okay, yeah. T-that was gross. Wow. Man, I think my eyes were bigger than my stomach on this one, Morty. Ugh. My appetite for purge-spectating got filled pretty quick. Oh, God. [ Grunts ]

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Get away from me! No! No! Help! Somebody help me! Aah!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: All right, Morty. L-let’s get out of here.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Wait, wait, wait. Hold on. W-we have to go down there.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: [ Belching ] What? Why?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: That poor girl. W-we have to save her.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Uh, Morty, in space, we have something we call the non-interference policy. We got the wiper fluid. We watched them kill each other. We’re leaving.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Help me save that girl, or I’m telling mom you brought me here.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You little turd. [ Screaming ]

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Please! Leave me alone!

sp.speaker: Man
sp.p: Leave you alone? During a purge?

sp.speaker: Man
sp.p: I don’t think so, baby.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It’s okay. We’re not gonna hurt you. My name is Morty. This is my grandpa. We’re tourists.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Not anymore. Aah! Aah! Oh, my God. This is [Bleep] awesome! Morty, this is really cool. Hey, y-you want to help me out here and kill some people? It’s fun. We’re totally justified because we’re saving a little girl. I mean, w-w-we’re both free and clear to murder these people.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Are you okay?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Yes. I have to find somewhere to hide.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Well, you can hide with us. Rick?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Do you think we could take... w-what’s your name?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Arthrisha.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Could we take arthrisha up in the ship and, you know, just wait out the purge?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, Morty, how can I refuse after all you’ve done to blackmail me?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Your vehicle... is it from the gods?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yes.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: So, uh, you know, when the purge started, did people get into it right away, or were they like, "wait, what?" This is gonna stop crime how, exactly?"

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Yeah, it took some time for people to accept it.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Yeah, I bet. [ Chuckles ] I bet. Yeah, it’s kind of like cellphones, you know? At first, everyone was like, "look at those douchebags purging," and then the next thing you know, they’re like, "it’s just so convenient."

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Geez, you working on your tight five for the comedy store, Morty?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Whatcha doing? Watching some TV, playing on your phone?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Is that a real question?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Just making conversation.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Are you? What part of that gives me anything to work with?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: My choice is to say nothing, be sarcastic, or bark "yes" like a trained animal. It’s not a conversation. You’re holding me verbally hostage.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Okay, ass-face. I’ll go in the kitchen.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Hey, dad.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yeah?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Whatcha doing? Going into the kitchen?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Okay.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Yeah, you like that?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Screw you.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: So, uh, do most people wear masks when they purge?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: I-I don’t want to answer any more purge questions.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: All right, hey, hey, that’s cool. I can roll with that.

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: [ Gasps ] My Nana!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Huh?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: My Nana! We have to save her!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You just now remembered your Nana exists.

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: I-I was traumatized.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Haven’t you been through like 15 purges? I mean, some as a child?

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Will somebody just help me get her?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Fine, whatever. Morty, stay.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, God. Oh, crap. Oh, crap!

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Get out! Get out!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hey, whoa, whoa, whoa!

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Get the [Bleep] out of the flying machine!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, my God! O-okay! Okay!

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Back up, asshole.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: [ Whimpers ]

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Back up.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ohh.

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: Back the [Bleep] up!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Aah!

sp.speaker: Arthrisha
sp.p: For what it’s worth, I’m sorry, but that’s not really worth anything tonight, is it?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Y-you can’t leave us here. You’re killing us! You hear me? Come back. Y-you got to come back. Change your mind. Oh, geez.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty! Aah! [Bleep] Amish bitch shot me! [ Grunts ] She tried to purge me, Morty. You let your wiener do the walking, and now I’m dead.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick, she took the car!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You [Bleep] kidding me, Morty?! She took my car and the gun. We’re like the rest of these assholes now. W-w-we’re gonna get purged, Morty. Help me up.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, geez, geez! Wait a minute, Rick. Why don’t we just use your portal gun?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: It’s in the car, dip-ass. [ Grunts ] Oh, God, it hurts. She got me right in the goddamn liver, Morty. It’s the hardest-working liver in the galaxy, Morty, and now it has a hole in it. I hope it was worth it.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I was just trying to do right.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, well, that’s not really the theme of tonight’s party. Heads up. Rapists. Well, don’t just stand there, Morty. Purge ‘em.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Me?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: No, me. Should I rub my liver hole on them? Pick up a stick or something and kill them.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um, w-we come in peace.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, my God. [ Grunts ] There’s more where that came from! You want to get purged, you bring it! Drop [Belches] drop your sh1t! Drop it all. Morty, go get their sh1t. Hurry up. I only had one of those things I threw. I’m holding a box of tic tacs right now.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Want some crackers?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: No, thank you.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Are you ready to be nice to me?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: In exchange for crackers?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: What happened to you?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, get a job.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You’re trying to create drama because you’re bored.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh. [ Beeping, whirring ] It’s the space phone grandpa gave us. Hello?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Hey, Summer, it’s grandpa. I need you to do me a favor.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I can barely hear you.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Who is it?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty and I are on a planet that’s purging. I need you to take down...

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: A plan that’s what?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: We’re on a planet that’s purging, Summer. Purging. We lost our car and my gun, and we’re in a purge.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Ooh, is it taddi Mason?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Like the movie "the purge"?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yes, I-I need you to take... that movie sucked.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh, my God. Hold on. It’s not taddi Mason? Dad, who the [Bleep] is taddi Mason? My friend.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Aah! Are you okay? I’m putting you on speaker.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Taddi?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yes, Jerry, it’s taddi, a person no one’s ever heard of until now, calling you on a space phone. I can’t tell if you’re being sarcastic.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: [ Growls ] Aah! [ Growling ] [ Gunshots ] Reload, fast.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Summer, w-we need you to take down this number. Quit screwing around.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Morty? Are you all right?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Why are you with taddi Mason?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Holy [Bleep] dad! Shut the [Bleep] up!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Okay. I guess I’m just this entire family’s toilet paper.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Are you writing this down? Will you please write this down?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Yes, yes.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: 7-7-1-9-8...[ Growling ] 3-6-4-2-1-1-2-5. Aah! [ Growling ] You son of a bitch! Morty, I don’t want to be the "a little help" guy, but a little help? Aah!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Okay, I have a pen. Go.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I’m sorry.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: There’s a pile of silverware next to you, and you throw me the one thing that can never kill anything?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: All right, okay!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Summer, on the shelf above my workbench in the garage, there’s a red box with a keypad on it. You’re gonna take that box outside, and you’re gonna type the number I just gave you into the keypad. Got it?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Got it. Is it just part of growing up to hate your dad?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I’m ignoring you. Morty, if I can get to the top of that lighthouse, I can send the beacon, and your sister can launch our package. Just remember, if there’s people in there and they try to purge us, we got to purge them first.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: We’re not purging anyone, Rick, all right? W-will you stop it?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty, if we’re gonna survive tonight, you’re gonna need to harness your repressed rage.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I don’t have any!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Spoken like a person with repressed rage.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: I take no part in the festival. If you desire to kill me, I only ask you do it quickly.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: No such agenda, chief.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: We’re not too keen on the purge, either, sir. We were just hoping to get on the roof of your lighthouse so we can send a beacon to my sister on earth. It’s a different planet.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: By the way, life on other planets exists. Don’t let it distract you.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: I’ll let you use my lighthouse for shelter and beacon-sending on the condition that you listen to my tale.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Okay.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Deal. All right, I’m gonna go to the roof and set things up. Morty, you listen to his tale.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Okay.

sp.speaker: lighthouse keeper
sp.p: [ Clears throat ] "Fade in. Exterior. Unnamed city. Day." The hustle and bustle is a symphony of progress. We pan past windows, each of which contain a different story, to find jacey lakims, 28... hot, but doesn’t know it. Jacey stops when her high heel gets caught in the grating of a sewer. Suddenly, a man steps into frame and points a gun at her. This is not her day. Fade to black. "Title... ‘three weeks earlier.’"

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: [ sighs ] You really don’t want to talk to me about this.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, grandpa and Morty are in danger. You’re unemployed, and you’re bored. They’re a higher priority.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Stop saying I’m unemployed!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Good lord! Now what? [ Whirring, humming ] Look, I’m your father, and I love you is all I’m saying. I’ll leave it at that.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Fine, dad! [ Both scream ] Oh, he might have said to take it outside.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Come on, Summer. How hard is it to type some numbers into a box? Target locked. [ Device beeps ] Oh, thank God. Well, I did my job. Summer did her job. Now all Morty has to do is finish listening to that tale.

sp.speaker: lighthouse keeper
sp.p: "Blane: Maybe I don’t need a new friend." Jacey: Maybe you’re the only friend I need. Blane: Need, or want? Jacey: I’ve never been much for wanting. "Blane: Spoken like someone with needs."

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, geez.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Hmm?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Uh, sorry. K-keep going.

sp.speaker: lighthouse keeper
sp.p: "Jacey reaches out and touches his face." It’s clear he needs what she wants. She’s a woman. He’s a man. The city burns in the background as he takes her in his arms. Fade out. Title... ‘the end’... "Question mark."

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Wow.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Yeah?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It’s... G-good job. Good job.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: You liked it?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Of course I did.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: You didn’t laugh at the scene in the bar.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I...Thought it was funny, but I wanted to hear the rest.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Do you have any thoughts? Notes?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No. I-I just enjoyed it. That’s my note, you know? Please write more.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Seems a little insincere.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: What? No.

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: You don’t have to mollycoddle me. I want to improve my writing. Tell me your real thoughts.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: All right. Well, um, I’m not a huge fan, personally, of the whole "three weeks earlier" teaser thing. I feel like, you know, we should start our stories where they begin not start them where they get interest...

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: get out.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Um, what?

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: No, I’m sick of this. You bang on my door, you beg me to help you, I share something personal with you, and you take a giant sh1t on it.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hey, man, we asked if we could put up a beacon...

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: well, you can’t. I want you out of here. You’re a petty person, and you’re insecure, and you’re taking it out on me. That’s a good script.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: What the hell?!

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: I don’t care. I want you out.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: What?

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Take that thing down. Your grandson is a shitty person. Leave now.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick, I didn’t do anything. I sat through his entire screenplay...

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: you "sat through it"?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Yes! Did you want me to weep with joy? It’s terrible!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whoa! Morty! We’re guests here.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I tried to be a good guest! He dragged it out of me!

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: I’m taking down this beacon.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No, stop! That’s not fair! Just because you hate your own writing doesn’t make me a bad person!

sp.speaker: Lighthouse Keeper
sp.p: Aah!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You like that? You want me to cut to three weeks earlier when you were alive?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whoa, Morty. You just purged. [Beacon arriving. Device beeps ] Okay, time to go.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well, terrific.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: [ Sighs ] Dad, what’s going on? What’s the deal here?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I just wanted to spend some time with my daughter. You’re growing up so fast. You used to be my little girl.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: [ Chuckles ] Yeah.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Remember when we used to go to the playground, and I’d push you on the swings?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh, you could push me higher than all the other kids.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You were so small and cute. I thought you were gonna fly right off into the street.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: [ Chuckling ] I used to pee my pants.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I know, and now look at you! You have a job. You’re making really good money. You’re not paying any rent, so you have plenty of disposable income.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh, God, dad. Please, don’t.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I just need a few hundred dollars to get through the month. I have some interviews coming up. Something’s gonna come through. I can feel it.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: I’m going inside.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: [ Sighs ] I guess this is what rock bottom feels like, Jerry.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ow!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: It’s okay, Morty. It’s the purge, you know? Pushing old lighthouse keepers down the stairs is totally cool.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It’s not cool, Rick. I-I’m not like these people. I can’t run around chopping people’s heads off one day a year and then sleep well the rest of the time.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Well, you better start getting used to it, little bitch, because we got some [Bleep] company.

sp.speaker: Pursuers
sp.p: Hey, there he is.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Here I am. [ Beacon whirring ] Morty. Time to [Belches] purge.

body.stage: [ Gunfire, screaming ] [ Tony! Toni! Toné!’S "feels good" plays ] [ Screaming ] [♪ it feels good ♪ ♪ yeah ♪ ♪ it feels good ♪ ♪ holdin’ you so ♪ ♪ it feels good geez. ♪

sp.p: Wow, Morty. Now you’re getting into it. Never expected that out of you. All right, uh, let’s go find my ship. Hey, hey, Morty, Morty. There it is down there... my ship. It looks to me like the... Morty? [ Gunfire ]
